programme.title: Storage Hunters

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Buyer Beware: A covered car lures big bids, but the reveal could be more than the winner bargained for. Then, as the temperature rises, Jesse loses out to Dan. (S1, ep 18)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Reel Money: The guys stumble on a laser tag system used for military training and an angler's fighting chair from the 70s. But the latter is in dire need of a refurb. (S2, ep 25)

programme.title: Auction Hunters

programme.title: Storage Wars

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: It's a Safe Time to Get Lit!: Kenny rides a recent string of luck right into his unit, while Rene puts his bankroll up against a pair of safes. (S14, ep 16)

programme.desc: Back in Action: Les's return proves a shock for Seth and Ashley, who have let profits drop in his absence. Back in charge, Les cuts a deal that could set the shop on fire.

programme.title: Pawn Stars

programme.desc: Current affairs with a comedic slant. Dara O Briain and the regulars are joined by guests Greg Davies, Gary Delaney and Jo Caulfield to poke fun at the great and good.

programme.desc: New. The hilarious Paul Chowdhry introduces comedians Ania Magliano and Ian Smith to the stage.

programme.title: Australian Ninja Warrior
programme.desc: Only the very best made it through the heats, but now the competition steps up a gear as the show enters the semi-finals of its second series.

programme.title: The Joy of Techs

programme.title: James May's Things You Need To Know About Science
programme.desc: Evolution: James May treks off to find out how Charles Darwin's theory of natural selection explains why we are all mutants and what war is actually good for.

programme.title: Border Force America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A large shipment of fake fentanyl pills is intercepted, an automatic rifle is found inside a loudspeaker, and a woman dealing drugs for her boyfriend is captured.

programme.title: Border Force America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A truck with a shipment of wet wipes turns out to have a secret hidden inside, and a US citizen is caught with thousands of Tramadol tablets hidden in his hand luggage.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: Documentary series. Bernie struggles home in five Streamliner locos pulling 90 old coal wagons, and James wants to drive a diesel locomotive that he's been renovating for 20 years.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: Documentary series. Cracks appear in a multi-billion-dollar iron ore railroad, and learner driver James must survive the punishing Cockatoo run and the ire of instructor Dave Boyd.

programme.title: Special Ops: To Catch a Criminal

programme.title: Special Ops: To Catch a Criminal
programme.desc: Operation Harlequin: The Serious Fraud Office go undercover to investigate a suspect holiday home company offering exclusive residences in the sun-drenched Caribbean.

programme.title: Aussie Road Train Truckers
programme.desc: Scotty transports a 30,000-dollar haystack but has a problem with his trailer, a town that Jake is heading to is on fire, and Des tries to make it up a very steep hill.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The Hamster plays guinea pig as he is dropped into wildest Canada to test a watch with a built-in emergency beacon - Jeremy and James are tasked with driving to his rescue.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The big-hitting motoring magazine. James May has a go at world rallycross but has to cope with an unsupportive support crew of Jeremy and Richard, and actor Nicholas Hoult guests.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British

programme.desc: Rick heads into china clay pits to discover what is known locally as white gold - one of Cornwall's most important industries - cooks a simple sea bass, and visits his niece at Land's End.

programme.desc: Mill Street Bistro (Part 2/2): In the conclusion to the Mill Street Bistro saga, Gordon's disagreement with the proprietor erupts into one of his most intense confrontations.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Duffless: Homer fails a breathalyser test while driving home from the Duff brewery and has to quit drinking for a month.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Poker, Faith, and Eggs: When Mary has to rush George Sr to the hospital, the kids' grandmother Meemaw comes over to babysit for his three anxious offspring.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Therapist, a Comic Book, and a Breakfast Sausage: After choking on a sausage, Sheldon wrestles with a fear of solid foods and discovers comic books.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Torn Between Two Lovers: Haley struggles when she must choose between her past and present relationships. Manny returns to college while his girlfriend stays at Jay and Gloria's.

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Welcome to the Treehouse: Dave's so worried about the safety of a treehouse that Calvin's building for Grover, that he asks Marty to secretly supervise it.

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Welcome to the Hero: Dave earns Calvin's respect when he thwarts a robbery at the barbershop, but the recognition soon starts to go to his head...

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Welcome to the Challenge: A rival garage owner tries to steal Calvin's customers.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: The walls are closing in on Lucas, Dodger struggles to hide his emotions at work, and Diane gets more and more concerned about her child's behaviour.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Diane's shocked by what she finds on her son's phone. Dodger confides in Donny. And a family is torn apart...

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sheep.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chappy's: Gordon visits Chappy's in Tennessee, where the chef and owner's careless methods and less-than-appetising food have hurt his restaurant's local reputation.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Amy's Baking Company: At Amy's Baking Company in Scottsdale, Arizona, Gordon Ramsay meets a husband and wife team with a shocking contempt for customer feedback.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: To Cur with Love: Homer loses Santa's Little Helper but doesn't seem to care, until Grampa tells the story of Homer's long-lost childhood pup Bongo.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer Goes to Prep School: Homer joins an off-the-grid survivalist group who have a top-secret doomsday bunker.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Empathy Optimization: The gang plan a Sheldon-free weekend in Las Vegas after coping with his constant demands, rudeness and ingratitude when he was ill.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Meemaw Materialization: Sheldon is thrilled when his beloved grandma 'Meemaw' comes to visit, but his excitement fades when she butts heads with Amy.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Feud: Phil's upset to lose his position of social chair to his nemesis Gil. When he learns that Luke is competing against Gil's kid at wrestling, it becomes a personal battle.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Spring-a-Ding-Fling: Cameron oversees the school's big spring dance, but when a popular teacher returns from sabbatical, a bit of not-so-friendly competition blooms.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Barbarian Sublimation: Penny becomes addicted to an online game based on the world of Conan the Barbarian and begins to pester Sheldon for advice.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Griffin Equivalency: Full of confidence after being named one of People magazine's '30 to Watch Under 30', Raj hits on Penny and becomes impossibly arrogant.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Euclid Alternative: When Leonard can't drive Sheldon to and from work, the friends stage an intervention to overcome Sheldon's fear of getting behind the wheel.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cooper-Nowitzki Theorem: Sheldon's friends are mystified when a younger student is attracted to him, and her intense devotion soon becomes too much to bear.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Solar Calculator, a Game Ball, and a Cheerleader's Bosom: Sheldon struggles with his new-found popularity after he uses statistics to help the school football team.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Patch, a Modem, and a Zantac: Sheldon is determined to be proved right when a NASA official comes to school and dismisses one of his scientific suggestions.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Fabulous Faker Boy: Bart doesn't want to go to piano lessons, until he meets his beautiful teacher... Homer loses the last two hairs on his head.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Saga of Carl: Homer, Moe, Lenny and Carl win the lottery, but Carl runs off to Iceland with the winnings.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Electric Can Opener Fluctuation: Leonard's attempts to woo Penny are constantly thwarted. Sheldon heads to Texas after learning his friends meddled with his expedition data.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Jiminy Conjecture: Leonard and Penny feel awkward around each other after their romantic liaison, while Sheldon and Howard take bets to determine a species of cricket.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Gothowitz Deviation: Sheldon tries to modify Penny's behaviour, and rewards her with chocolate when she does what he wants, while Howard and Raj go to a goth nightclub.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Pirate Solution: Raj must find a job or he'll be sent back to India, so he accepts an offer of work from Sheldon. Leonard and Penny try to get some time for themselves.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Front: At his high school reunion, Homer wins several awards including 'Most Weight Gained' and 'Most Improved Odour'. But then the Principal finds out he never graduated.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Whacking Day: Lisa asks singer Barry White to help stop the cruel Springfield 'Whacking Day' tradition of hitting snakes with sticks.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Tony begins his physio sessions with Mercedes' support. Meanwhile, with the truth now revealed, tension rises between two residents.

programme.title: New: Animal Control
programme.desc: Brand new series - Tortoises and Labradors: US sitcom. Frank unearths an illegal animal smuggling ring. Shred's first night shift introduces him to the world of furry parties.

programme.title: America's Next Top Model
programme.desc: Erin Wasson: Series 16 of Tyra Banks' iconic reality series begins with a brutal switcheroo and a catwalk across a watery runway inside giant plastic bubbles.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Britain's sharpest armchair critics have been watching: Starstruck, The Home Edit, Made in Chelsea, SAS, This Is Going to Hurt, Dynasties II, and Pam & Tommy.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Will trainee astronaut Nicky's date with motoring journalist Daniel be out of this world? Road sweeper Bruce, who's 58, is looking for a lady who'll love him for who he is.

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: (2012) Sci-fi action-adventure starring Taylor Kitsch, Liam Neeson and Rihanna. When aliens land spacecraft in the Pacific Ocean, only the US and Japanese navies can save Earth. Violence.

programme.title: Terminator Genisys
programme.desc: (2015) Sci-fi thriller with Arnold Schwarzenegger and Emilia Clarke. Part five of the franchise follows Sarah Connor in an alternate timeline to the previous movies, as she takes on Skynet.

programme.title: National Anthem
programme.desc: (2023) Luke Gilford's beautifully-shot drama inspired by his book about the International Gay Rodeo Association. Charlie Plummer stars as a construction worker who finally finds his people.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: 100 Years of Deaflympics
programme.desc: A look back at the incredible sporting achievements of Great Britain's deaf athletes, and a spotlight on some of the medal hopefuls on their way to the 2025 Summer Deaflympics in Tokyo.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Saraband for Dead Lovers
programme.desc: (1948) Historical drama starring Joan Greenwood and Stewart Granger. Princess Dorothea marries the future king of England. But then she meets a Swedish count...

programme.title: Against the Wind
programme.desc: (1948) Spy thriller. Robert Beatty, Simone Signoret, Jack Warner and Gordon Jackson star as British-trained saboteurs sent to Second World War Belgium. But one of them is a traitor...

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: (1954) Crime-comedy starring Alec Guinness. A priest is tasked with accompanying a priceless religious artifact from London to Rome. But the prolific thief Flambeau is hot on his trail...

programme.title: Tolkien
programme.desc: (2019) Biographical drama starring Nicholas Hoult and Lily Collins, charting the early life and inspirations of Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit author JRR Tolkien.

programme.title: Men in Black: International
programme.desc: (2019) Fourth instalment of the sci-fi comedy franchise with Chris Hemsworth, Tessa Thompson and Liam Neeson. An alien-obsessed rookie joins London's Men in Black team.

programme.title: Vesper
programme.desc: (2022) Sci-fi fantasy with new-comer Raffiella Chapman and Eddie Marsan. A resourceful teenager scavenges to survive in a mushy and mushroom-y post-apocalyptic world of have and have-nots.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: (2007) Western starring Christian Bale and Russell Crowe. An impoverished rancher tries to earn some money and his family's respect by escorting a dangerous outlaw on his way to jail.

programme.title: Amanda
programme.desc: (2018) Mikhael Hers's quietly sensitive drama. A young man becomes responsible for raising his seven-year-old niece after his sister is killed in a Paris terrorist attack. In French/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Young Winston
programme.desc: (1972) Biopic charting the rise of the future PM from battered Harrow pupil to MP via military action on foreign soil. Directed by Richard Attenborough.

programme.title: Time Lock
programme.desc: (1957) Gripping drama with Robert Beatty. An expert team races against the clock to save a six-year-old boy who's been trapped in a seemingly impregnable bank vault.

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: (1970) Multi-Oscar-winning, fact-based, Second World War drama starring George C Scott, who gives a vivid portrait of the famously straight-talking US commander General George Patton.

programme.title: Instant Family
programme.desc: (2018) Comedy. Mark Wahlberg and Rose Byrne star as a couple whose orderly lives are disrupted when they foster three kids. Based on director Sean Anders' own experience.

programme.title: The Artifice Girl
programme.desc: (2022) Franklin Ritch's strikingly claustrophobic AI thriller. A man creates a virtual nine-year-old to lure online predators from the shadows. But as she learns, she becomes more real...

programme.title: Alita: Battle Angel
programme.desc: (2019) Partially animated action film based on a popular manga comic. Alita, a deadly cyborg brought back to life by a mourning scientist, sets out to discover her true identity.

programme.title: Hilary and Jackie
programme.desc: (1999) Fact-based drama about the lives of the troubled genius, cellist Jacqueline du Pr (Emily Watson) and her sister Hilary (Rachel Griffiths). With David Morrissey. Strong language.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Two Way Stretch
programme.desc: (1960) Comedy. Peter Sellers, Bernard Cribbins and David Lodge star as criminals happily incarcerated in a prison run like a home-from-home for old lags and rascals by a liberal governor.

programme.title: A Kid for Two Farthings
programme.desc: (1955) Carol Reed's charming film stars Jonathan Ashmore as a young, impressionable boy who mistakes a one-horned goat for a unicorn in London's colourful Petticoat Lane market.

programme.title: Nothing But the Best
programme.desc: (1964) Classic British dark comedy with Alan Bates and Denholm Elliott. An ambitious estate agent's clerk hires a toff to teach him to be posh. Couldn't possibly lead to murder, could it?

programme.title: The Sheriff of Fractured Jaw
programme.desc: (1959) Comedy western with Kenneth More. An English gunsmith decides the Wild West is the best market for his wares, but little does he expect to end up sheriff of a lawless frontier town.

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: (1989) Star-studded tragi-comedy with Julia Roberts, Daryl Hannah, Dolly Parton and more. Six Southern belles console and cajole each other through life in a Louisiana beauty parlour.

programme.title: Moon
programme.desc: (2009) Psychological sci-fi thriller. Sam Rockwell stars as a man who lives alone on the moon overseeing a mining operation. His time's nearly done, but he's started to go a bit peculiar...

programme.title: Darkman
programme.desc: (1990) Liam Neeson and Frances McDormand star in Sam Raimi's crime-fighting action-fantasy. A scientist uses his invention to seek revenge on his attackers.

programme.desc: (2012) Sci-fi action-adventure starring Taylor Kitsch, Liam Neeson and Rihanna. When aliens land spacecraft in the Pacific Ocean, only the US and Japanese navies can save Earth. Violence.

programme.desc: Join Alex for two hours of lively debate and news making interviews. Top guests tackle the big issues of the day with Alex's fresh take on every story.

programme.desc: Tomorrow's news, tonight. All the major stories making the front pages and full coverage of all the breaking news at home and abroad with Alex Armstrong.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: AC Cobra/Volvo F8T8: The team have a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: E Type S2/Escort RS Turbo: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Rolls Silver Shadow/Austin 7: A widow reluctantly parts with her husband's treasured collection of Rolls Royces and Bentleys, and an impulse buyer finds one of the cars a new home.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Elgin to Loch Ness: Michael Portillo visits Lossiemouth and Inverness. His journey ends at Loch Ness, where he joins a Deep Scan research team searching for the elusive monster.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: St Ives to St Day: Michael Portillo explores the West Country between the wars, setting off from the Cornish seaside resort of St Ives and ending in the former mining village of St Day.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Truro to St Mawgan: Michael Portillo visits Cornwall's county town, Truro, heading to the historic estate of Trewithen, whose gardens were stocked from China by plant hunters.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Bodmin to Totnes: Michael Portillo reaches Bodmin en route to Totnes, as he explores the West Country from St Ives to Salisbury Plain, learning more about Daphne du Maurier on the way.

programme.desc: Austin Gipsy / Toyota MR2 Ferrari: Derek heads to Scotland in a rainstorm to pick up a Jaguar E-type and a rare MGC convertible, and Dave extracts a rare Austin Gipsey from a lock-up.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Ford Thames 400E/Vauxhall Astra: Derek collects a Ford Thames 400E that once belonged to the pop band Edison Lighthouse. Plus, Dave heads to York to collect an Astra GTE convertible.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: General Motors: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors.

programme.title: The World at War

programme.desc: Compilation - Abbotsford and Burghley: Fiona Bruce presents assessments of items not initially shown in programmes from Abbotsford and Burghley.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
